body.p: The Grinder is free software. It also repackages other free software. This section explains what you can and cannot do with The Grinder and the software included with it.

section.title: The Grinder

section.title: Third Party Licenses
section.p: The Grinder includes Ronald Tschalär's HTTPClient library. The HTTPClient library is distributed under the GNU Lesser Public License 2.1. Under the term 6 of the GNU Lesser Public License, The Grinder is a "work that uses the Library".
The Grinder includes the software Jython, created by Jim Hugunin, Barry Warsaw and the Jython team. This is distributed under the terms of the Jython and JPython software licenses.
The Grinder includes the jEdit Syntax highlighting package. This is distributed according to the jEdit Syntax copyright and usage statement.
section.source:
The jEdit 2.2.1 syntax highlighting package contains code that is Copyright 1998-1999 Slava Pestov, Artur Biesiadowski, Clancy Malcolm, Jonathan Revusky, Juha Lindfors and Mike Dillon.
You may use and modify this package for any purpose. Redistribution is permitted, in both source and binary form, provided that this notice remains intact in all source distributions of this package.
-- Slava Pestov 25 September 2000 <sp@gjt.org>
section.p: The Grinder includes Apache XMLBeans, under the terms of the Apache License Version 2.0.
section.source:

section.p: The Grinder includes ASM. This is distributed under the terms of the ASM license.
The Grinder includes components from the extra166y package. This package is in the public domain. See http://g.oswego.edu/dl/concurrency-interest/.
